tool.name: System Setup

param.name: extrain
param.label: Custom topology and parameter files for ligands

tool.help:
.. class:: infomark
**What it does**
This tool prepares a protein-ligand system in water using CHARMM. Structure and coordinate files of the protein-ligand complex are used to setup the system for molecular dynamics simulations. The CHARMM GUI PDB reader web interface (http://www.charmm-gui.org/?doc=input/pdbreader) can be used to create the initial structure (psf) and coordinate (.crd) files.
The setup is done in three steps.
- Solvating the protein-ligand complex in a water box of TIP3P water molecules. - Neutralizing the system by using 0.05 M NaCl. - Combining all systems followed by a small energy minimization (50 steps) inside the water box.
_____
.. class:: infomark
**Input**
- The coordinate (.crd) file (in CHARMM format) of the protein-ligand system. - The protein structure file (.psf) of the protein-ligand system. - Buffer region or edge to edge distance between the protein and the edge of the water box. - Custom topology and parameter file (optional).
_____
.. class:: infomark
**Output**
- .pdb file of the prepared system for classical MD simulations. - .crd file of the prepared system for classical MD simulations. - .psf file of the prepared system for classical MD simulations. - Water box parameters (type, size, etc.). - CHARMM output file.
